vc.prottype: FWLIBAPI short WINAPI cnc_rdpmacror2( unsigned short FlibHndl, unsigned long stnum, unsigned long *num, unsigned short type, double *mcval);

cmn.p: Reads the P code macro variables(variables for the macro-executor) specified by the starting number, "stnum", and number of variables, "*num". The data is stored in "mcval" with double format. It is not influenced by setting of cnc_setpmactype function.
The value of an undefined variable is called "vacant", and it is expressed as follows.
See the "PROGRAMING MANUAL" of the macro-executor for details of the P code macro variable.

content.p: Specify the library handle. See "Library handle" for details.

Specify the starting P code macro variable number.
Please refer to the document of the cnc_rdpmacroinfo2 for the range of variable.

Specify the number of P code macro variables to be read.
This function returns the total number of variables that was actually read.

item.name: type
item.content:
Specify the type of macro variables to be read from followings.
0:conversation
1:auxiliary
2:execution
* This setting is ignored in case of P code macro variables, 10000,..,89999 and the variables for High-speed cycle cutting.

content.p:
Specify the array for read P code macro variables.
When the variable is "vacant", the 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF is set.

item.name: EW_LENGTH
item.content:
Data block length error
The number of P code macro variables(*num) is 0 or less.

item.name: EW_NUMBER
item.content:
Data number error
P code macro variable number(stnum) is wrong.

item.name: EW_ATTRIB
item.content:
Data attribute error
Type of P code macro variables(type) is wrong.

item.name: EW_NOOPT
item.content:
No option
This function needs the macro-executor option.

option.hssb: The extended driver/library function is necessary.

ethr.p: The Ethernet function and the extended driver/library function are necessary.
However, in case of Series 0i-D/F, Series 30i and PMi-A, the required CNC option is as follows.

p.ul: above two optional functions are not required.

add.p: But, this function is related to the compile parameter of the macro-executor. See the "PROGRAMING MANUAL" of the macro-executor for details of the compile parameter.
